qas.question: What term is used interchangeably with daylight saving time?
What period of time do we set our clocks forward in DST?
What do we get an extra hour of because we set the clocks forward?
In what season do regions who practice DST set the clocks back one hour?
By setting the clocks forward, the normal time of what daily event is disrupted?

context: Daylight saving time (DST) or <a0_0>summer time<a0_0/> is the practice of advancing clocks during summer months by <a1_0>one hour<a1_0/> so that in the evening <a2_0>daylight<a2_0/> is experienced an hour longer, while sacrificing normal <a4_0>sunrise<a4_0/> times. Typically, regions with summer time adjust clocks forward one hour close to the start of spring and adjust them backward in the <a3_0>autumn<a3_0/> to standard time.
